@naval Psyops are underrated in a world where narratives have become so fragile.

To inject some bias, I do believe in tech thesis that smart contract platforms will vastly exceed value held in hard money via $BTC.

$ETH at scale absorbs entire financial systems. Bonds, mortgages, trusts etc‚Ä¶

Smart contract platforms enable digitized ownership of everything.

If you believe in the tech thesis you believe the mkt demand for smart contracts exceeds that of hard money.

In this case $ETH becomes more valuable that $BTC.

Assets are priced relative to each other. That means alt L1‚Äôs likely follow $ETH since the pie has become much bigger.

$BTC dom is currently 42%. If you believe in the money thesis, you believe that this dominance will continue to stay relevant & high. 

Hard money will be adopted by nations and remain more valuable and in demand than smart contract systems.

For those who prefer hands off, a simple thesis is to view $BTC as hard money and $ETH as banking/custody.

For those who want an active approach, Layer 2 scaling solutions and alt Layer 1‚Äôs should be of interest.

Each of these comes w/ ecosystems beneath worth exploring.

Note: Crypto is still far too small for nation state adoption at scale.

The mkt cap of $ETH is less than Home Depot‚Ä¶

As an investor there‚Äôs an opportunity to frontrun the head spinning transfer of wealth that‚Äôs coming.

These adoption curves span decades. It‚Äôs still early.

Russia being forced out of financial systems forces them to flee to the Yuan or Crypto.

Expect to see this trend accelerate as nations hedge their reliance on centralized systems with crypto. https://t.co/ejOjTFlWrJ

It‚Äôs incredible to see the adoption of crypto go from tech nerds to nation states so quickly.

First they ignore -> then laugh -> then fight -> then you win.

Nobody is laughing anymore, which means we‚Äôre getting closer. https://t.co/H39pqtgAnd
